5 tech myths that are costing you money:

(#3 will shock you) 🧵

MYTH 1: "More megapixels = better camera"

FALSE.

Sensor size and processing matter more.

A 12MP iPhone often beats a 108MP budget phone.

Don't fall for the megapixel marketing.

MYTH 2: "You need to drain your battery before charging"

NOPE.

This was true for old batteries (pre-2010).

Modern lithium batteries prefer partial charges.

Keeping it 20-80% actually extends battery life.

MYTH 3: "More RAM always means faster phone"

Not quite.

8GB poorly optimized < 6GB well optimized

iPhones run smooth on 6GB because of software optimization.

Android needs more RAM because of how it manages apps.

MYTH 4: "Expensive HDMI cables perform better"

BIGGEST SCAM.

$10 cable = $100 cable for 4K/HDR.

It's digital. Either works or doesn't.

Save your money for actual tech upgrades.

MYTH 5: "Closing apps saves battery"

ACTUALLY DRAINS MORE.

Restarting apps uses more power than keeping them in memory.

Let your phone manage this.

You're not helping, you're hurting.
